documentation.description: An object of this type can be returned on every function call, in case of an error
documentation.code: Error code; subject to future changes. If the error code is 406, the error message must not be processed in any way and must not be displayed to the user
documentation.message: Error message; subject to future changes

documentation.description: An object of this type is returned on a successful function call for certain functions
Contains parameters for TDLib initialization
documentation.use_test_dc: If set to true, the Telegram test environment will be used instead of the production environment
documentation.database_directory: The path to the directory for the persistent database; if empty, the current working directory will be used
documentation.files_directory: The path to the directory for storing files; if empty, database_directory will be used
documentation.use_file_database: If set to true, information about downloaded and uploaded files will be saved between application restarts
documentation.use_chat_info_database: If set to true, the library will maintain a cache of users, basic groups, supergroups, channels and secret chats. Implies use_file_database
documentation.use_message_database: If set to true, the library will maintain a cache of chats and messages. Implies use_chat_info_database
documentation.use_secret_chats: If set to true, support for secret chats will be enabled
documentation.api_id: Application identifier for Telegram API access, which can be obtained at https://my.telegram.org
documentation.api_hash: Application identifier hash for Telegram API access, which can be obtained at https://my.telegram.org
documentation.system_language_code: IETF language tag of the user's operating system language; must be non-empty
documentation.device_model: Model of the device the application is being run on; must be non-empty
documentation.system_version: Version of the operating system the application is being run on. If empty, the version is automatically detected by TDLib
documentation.enable_storage_optimizer: If set to true, old files will automatically be deleted
documentation.ignore_file_names: If set to true, original file names will be ignored. Otherwise, downloaded files will be saved under names as close as possible to the original name

documentation.description: An authentication code is delivered via a private Telegram message, which can be viewed from another active session
An authentication code is delivered via an SMS message to the specified phone number
An authentication code is delivered via a phone call to the specified phone number
An authentication code is delivered by an immediately canceled call to the specified phone number. The phone number that calls is the code that must be entered automatically
documentation.pattern: Pattern of the phone number from which the call will be made

documentation.description: An authentication code is delivered by an immediately canceled call to the specified phone number. The last digits of the phone number that calls are the code that must be entered manually by the user
documentation.phone_number_prefix: Prefix of the phone number from which the call will be made
documentation.length: Number of digits in the code, excluding the prefix

documentation.description: Information about the authentication code that was sent
documentation.phone_number: A phone number that is being authenticated
documentation.type: The way the code was sent to the user
documentation.next_type: The way the next code will be sent to the user; may be null
documentation.timeout: Timeout before the code can be re-sent, in seconds

documentation.description: Information about the email address authentication code that was sent
documentation.email_address_pattern: Pattern of the email address to which an authentication code was sent
documentation.length: Length of the code; 0 if unknown

documentation.description: Represents a part of the text that needs to be formatted in some unusual way
documentation.offset: Offset of the entity, in UTF-16 code units
documentation.length: Length of the entity, in UTF-16 code units

documentation.description: Contains a list of text entities
A text with some entities
documentation.entities: Entities contained in the text. Entities can be nested, but must not mutually intersect with each other. -Pre, Code and PreCode entities can't contain other entities. Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikethrough, and Spoiler entities can contain and to be contained in all other entities. All other entities can't contain each other

documentation.description: Contains Telegram terms of service
documentation.text: Text of the terms of service
documentation.min_user_age: The minimum age of a user to be able to accept the terms; 0 if age isn't restricted
documentation.show_popup: True, if a blocking popup with terms of service must be shown to the user

documentation.description: TDLib needs TdlibParameters for initialization
TDLib needs an encryption key to decrypt the local database
documentation.is_encrypted: True, if the database is currently encrypted

documentation.description: TDLib needs the user's phone number to authorize. Call `setAuthenticationPhoneNumber` to provide the phone number, or use `requestQrCodeAuthentication`, or `checkAuthenticationBotToken` for other authentication options
TDLib needs the user's authentication code to authorize
documentation.code_info: Information about the authorization code that was sent

documentation.description: The user needs to confirm authorization on another logged in device by scanning a QR code with the provided link
documentation.link: A tg:// URL for the QR code. The link will be updated frequently

documentation.description: The user is unregistered and need to accept terms of service and enter their first name and last name to finish registration
The user has been authorized, but needs to enter a password to start using the application
documentation.password_hint: Hint for the password; may be empty
documentation.has_recovery_email_address: True, if a recovery email address has been set up
documentation.recovery_email_address_pattern: Pattern of the email address to which the recovery email was sent; empty until a recovery email has been sent

documentation.description: The user has been successfully authorized. TDLib is now ready to answer queries
The user is currently logging out

TDLib is closing, all subsequent queries will be answered with the error 500. Note that closing TDLib can take a while. All resources will be freed only after authorizationStateClosed has been received

TDLib client is in its final state. All databases are closed and all resources are released. No other updates will be received after this. All queries will be responded to -with error code 500. To continue working, one must create a new instance of the TDLib client
Represents the current state of 2-step verification
documentation.has_password: True, if a 2-step verification password is set
documentation.password_hint: Hint for the password; may be empty
documentation.has_recovery_email_address: True, if a recovery email is set
documentation.has_passport_data: True, if some Telegram Passport elements were saved
documentation.recovery_email_address_code_info: Information about the recovery email address to which the confirmation email was sent; may be null
documentation.pending_reset_date: If not 0, point in time (Unix timestamp) after which the password can be reset immediately using resetPassword

documentation.description: Contains information about the current recovery email address
Returns information about the availability of a temporary password, which can be used for payments
documentation.has_password: True, if a temporary password is available
documentation.valid_for: Time left before the temporary password expires, in seconds

documentation.description: Represents a local file
documentation.path: Local path to the locally available file part; may be empty
documentation.can_be_downloaded: True, if it is possible to download or generate the file
documentation.can_be_deleted: True, if the file can be deleted
documentation.is_downloading_active: True, if the file is currently being downloaded (or a local copy is being generated by some other means)
documentation.is_downloading_completed: True, if the local copy is fully available
documentation.download_offset: Download will be started from this offset. downloaded_prefix_size is calculated from this offset
documentation.downloaded_prefix_size: If is_downloading_completed is false, then only some prefix of the file starting from download_offset is ready to be read. downloaded_prefix_size is the size of that prefix in bytes
documentation.downloaded_size: Total downloaded file size, in bytes. Can be used only for calculating download progress. The actual file size may be bigger, and some parts of it may contain garbage

documentation.description: Represents a remote file
documentation.id: Remote file identifier; may be empty. Can be used by the current user across application restarts or even from other devices. Uniquely identifies a file, but a file can have a lot of different valid identifiers. -If the ID starts with "http://" or "https://", it represents the HTTP URL of the file. TDLib is currently unable to download files if only their URL is known. -If downloadFile/addFileToDownloads is called on such a file or if it is sent to a secret chat, TDLib starts a file generation process by sending updateFileGenerationStart to the application with the HTTP URL in the original_path and "#url#" as the conversion string. Application must generate the file by downloading it to the specified location
documentation.unique_id: Unique file identifier; may be empty if unknown. The unique file identifier which is the same for the same file even for different users and is persistent over time
documentation.is_uploading_active: True, if the file is currently being uploaded (or a remote copy is being generated by some other means)
documentation.is_uploading_completed: True, if a remote copy is fully available
documentation.uploaded_size: Size of the remote available part of the file, in bytes; 0 if unknown

documentation.description: Represents a file
documentation.id: Unique file identifier
documentation.size: File size, in bytes; 0 if unknown
documentation.expected_size: Approximate file size in bytes in case the exact file size is unknown. Can be used to show download/upload progress
documentation.local: Information about the local copy of the file
documentation.remote: Information about the remote copy of the file

documentation.description: A file defined by its unique ID
documentation.id: Unique file identifier

documentation.description: A file defined by its remote ID. The remote ID is guaranteed to be usable only if the corresponding file is still accessible to the user and known to TDLib. -For example, if the file is from a message, then the message must be not deleted and accessible to the user. If the file database is disabled, then the corresponding object with the file must be preloaded by the application
documentation.id: Remote file identifier

documentation.description: A file defined by a local path
A file generated by the application
documentation.original_path: Local path to a file from which the file is generated; may be empty if there is no such file
documentation.conversion: String specifying the conversion applied to the original file; must be persistent across application restarts. Conversions beginning with '#' are reserved for internal TDLib usage
documentation.expected_size: Expected size of the generated file, in bytes; 0 if unknown

documentation.description: Describes an image in JPEG format
documentation.progressive_sizes: Sizes of progressive JPEG file prefixes, which can be used to preliminarily show the image; in bytes

documentation.description: Thumbnail image of a very poor quality and low resolution
The thumbnail is in JPEG format
The thumbnail is in static GIF format. It will be used only for some bot inline results
The thumbnail is in MPEG4 format. It will be used only for some animations and videos
The thumbnail is in PNG format. It will be used only for background patterns
The thumbnail is in TGS format. It will be used only for TGS sticker sets
The thumbnail is in WEBM format. It will be used only for WEBM sticker sets
The thumbnail is in WEBP format. It will be used only for some stickers
Represents a thumbnail
The mask is placed relatively to the forehead
The mask is placed relatively to the eyes
The mask is placed relatively to the mouth
The mask is placed relatively to the chin
Position on a photo where a mask is placed
documentation.point: Part of the face, relative to which the mask is placed
documentation.x_shift: Shift by X-axis measured in widths of the mask scaled to the face size, from left to right. (For example, -1.0 will place the mask just to the left of the default mask position)
documentation.y_shift: Shift by Y-axis measured in heights of the mask scaled to the face size, from top to bottom. (For example, 1.0 will place the mask just below the default mask position)
documentation.scale: Mask scaling coefficient. (For example, 2.0 means a doubled size)

documentation.description: The sticker is an image in WEBP format
The sticker is an animation in TGS format
The sticker is a video in WEBM format
The sticker is a mask in WEBP format to be placed on photos or videos
documentation.mask_position: Position where the mask is placed; may be null

documentation.description: Represents a closed vector path. The path begins at the end point of the last command
Describes one answer option of a poll
documentation.voter_count: Number of voters for this option, available only for closed or voted polls
documentation.vote_percentage: The percentage of votes for this option; 0-100
documentation.is_chosen: True, if the option was chosen by the user
documentation.is_being_chosen: True, if the option is being chosen by a pending setPollAnswer request

documentation.description: A regular poll
documentation.allow_multiple_answers: True, if multiple answer options can be chosen simultaneously

documentation.description: A poll in quiz mode, which has exactly one correct answer option and can be answered only once
documentation.correct_option_id: 0-based identifier of the correct answer option; -1 for a yet unanswered poll
documentation.explanation: Text that is shown when the user chooses an incorrect answer or taps on the lamp icon; 0-200 characters with at most 2 line feeds; empty for a yet unanswered poll

documentation.description: Describes an animation file. The animation must be encoded in GIF or MPEG4 format
documentation.duration: Duration of the animation, in seconds; as defined by the sender
documentation.file_name: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.mime_type: MIME type of the file, usually "image/gif" or "video/mp4"
documentation.has_stickers: True, if stickers were added to the animation. The list of corresponding sticker set can be received using getAttachedStickerSets
documentation.thumbnail: Animation thumbnail in JPEG or MPEG4 format; may be null

documentation.description: Describes an audio file. Audio is usually in MP3 or M4A format
documentation.duration: Duration of the audio, in seconds; as defined by the sender
documentation.title: Title of the audio; as defined by the sender
documentation.performer: Performer of the audio; as defined by the sender
documentation.file_name: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.mime_type: The MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.album_cover_minithumbnail: The minithumbnail of the album cover; may be null
documentation.album_cover_thumbnail: The thumbnail of the album cover in JPEG format; as defined by the sender. The full size thumbnail is supposed to be extracted from the downloaded file; may be null

documentation.description: Describes a document of any type
documentation.file_name: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.mime_type: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.thumbnail: Document thumbnail in JPEG or PNG format (PNG will be used only for background patterns); as defined by the sender; may be null

documentation.description: Describes a photo
documentation.has_stickers: True, if stickers were added to the photo. The list of corresponding sticker sets can be received using getAttachedStickerSets
documentation.sizes: Available variants of the photo, in different sizes

documentation.description: Describes a sticker
documentation.set_id: The identifier of the sticker set to which the sticker belongs; 0 if none
documentation.width: Sticker width; as defined by the sender
documentation.height: Sticker height; as defined by the sender
documentation.outline: Sticker's outline represented as a list of closed vector paths; may be empty. The coordinate system origin is in the upper-left corner
documentation.thumbnail: Sticker thumbnail in WEBP or JPEG format; may be null
documentation.premium_animation: Premium animation of the sticker; may be null. If present, only Premium users can send the sticker

documentation.description: Describes a video file
documentation.duration: Duration of the video, in seconds; as defined by the sender
documentation.width: Video width; as defined by the sender
documentation.height: Video height; as defined by the sender
documentation.file_name: Original name of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.mime_type: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.has_stickers: True, if stickers were added to the video. The list of corresponding sticker sets can be received using getAttachedStickerSets
documentation.supports_streaming: True, if the video is supposed to be streamed
documentation.thumbnail: Video thumbnail in JPEG or MPEG4 format; as defined by the sender; may be null

documentation.description: Describes a video note. The video must be equal in width and height, cropped to a circle, and stored in MPEG4 format
documentation.duration: Duration of the video, in seconds; as defined by the sender
documentation.length: Video width and height; as defined by the sender
documentation.thumbnail: Video thumbnail in JPEG format; as defined by the sender; may be null

documentation.description: Describes a voice note. The voice note must be encoded with the Opus codec, and stored inside an OGG container. Voice notes can have only a single audio channel
documentation.duration: Duration of the voice note, in seconds; as defined by the sender
documentation.waveform: A waveform representation of the voice note in 5-bit format
documentation.mime_type: MIME type of the file; as defined by the sender
documentation.is_recognized: True, if speech recognition is completed; Premium users only
documentation.recognized_text: Recognized text of the voice note; Premium users only. Call recognizeSpeech to get recognized text of the voice note

documentation.description: Describes an animated representation of an emoji
documentation.fitzpatrick_type: Emoji modifier fitzpatrick type; 0-6; 0 if none
documentation.sound: File containing the sound to be played when the animated emoji is clicked; may be null. The sound is encoded with the Opus codec, and stored inside an OGG container

documentation.description: Describes a user contact
documentation.first_name: First name of the user; 1-255 characters in length
documentation.vcard: Additional data about the user in a form of vCard; 0-2048 bytes in length
documentation.user_id: Identifier of the user, if known; otherwise 0

documentation.description: Describes a location on planet Earth
documentation.latitude: Latitude of the location in degrees; as defined by the sender
documentation.longitude: Longitude of the location, in degrees; as defined by the sender
documentation.horizontal_accuracy: The estimated horizontal accuracy of the location, in meters; as defined by the sender. 0 if unknown

documentation.description: Describes a venue
documentation.location: Venue location; as defined by the sender
documentation.title: Venue name; as defined by the sender
documentation.address: Venue address; as defined by the sender
documentation.provider: Provider of the venue database; as defined by the sender. Currently, only "foursquare" and "gplaces" (Google Places) need to be supported
documentation.id: Identifier of the venue in the provider database; as defined by the sender
documentation.type: Type of the venue in the provider database; as defined by the sender

documentation.description: Describes a game
documentation.id: Game ID
documentation.short_name: Game short name. To share a game use the URL https://t.me/{bot_username}?game={game_short_name}
documentation.title: Game title
documentation.text: Game text, usually containing scoreboards for a game

documentation.description: Describes a poll
documentation.id: Unique poll identifier
documentation.question: Poll question; 1-300 characters
documentation.total_voter_count: Total number of voters, participating in the poll
documentation.recent_voter_user_ids: User identifiers of recent voters, if the poll is non-anonymous
documentation.is_anonymous: True, if the poll is anonymous
documentation.open_period: Amount of time the poll will be active after creation, in seconds
documentation.close_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the poll will automatically be closed
documentation.is_closed: True, if the poll is closed

documentation.description: Describes a user profile photo
documentation.id: Photo identifier; 0 for an empty photo. Can be used to find a photo in a list of user profile photos
documentation.small: A small (160x160) user profile photo. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed
documentation.big: A big (640x640) user profile photo. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed
documentation.minithumbnail: User profile photo minithumbnail; may be null
documentation.has_animation: True, if the photo has animated variant

documentation.description: Contains basic information about the photo of a chat
documentation.small: A small (160x160) chat photo variant in JPEG format. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed
documentation.big: A big (640x640) chat photo variant in JPEG format. The file can be downloaded only before the photo is changed
documentation.minithumbnail: Chat photo minithumbnail; may be null
documentation.has_animation: True, if the photo has animated variant

documentation.description: A regular user
A deleted user or deleted bot. No information on the user besides the user identifier is available. It is not possible to perform any active actions on this type of user
A bot (see https://core.telegram.org/bots)
documentation.can_join_groups: True, if the bot can be invited to basic group and supergroup chats
documentation.can_read_all_group_messages: True, if the bot can read all messages in basic group or supergroup chats and not just those addressed to the bot. In private and channel chats a bot can always read all messages
documentation.is_inline: True, if the bot supports inline queries
documentation.inline_query_placeholder: Placeholder for inline queries (displayed on the application input field)
documentation.need_location: True, if the location of the user is expected to be sent with every inline query to this bot
documentation.can_be_added_to_attachment_menu: True, if the bot can be added to attachment menu

documentation.description: No information on the user besides the user identifier is available, yet this user has not been deleted. This object is extremely rare and must be handled like a deleted user. It is not possible to perform any actions on users of this type
Represents a command supported by a bot
Contains a list of bot commands
Describes a button to be shown instead of bot commands menu button
documentation.url: URL to be passed to openWebApp

documentation.description: Represents a location to which a chat is connected
documentation.address: Location address; 1-64 characters, as defined by the chat owner

documentation.description: Animated variant of a chat photo in MPEG4 format
documentation.main_frame_timestamp: Timestamp of the frame, used as a static chat photo

documentation.description: Describes a chat or user profile photo
documentation.id: Unique photo identifier
documentation.added_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the photo has been added
documentation.sizes: Available variants of the photo in JPEG format, in different size
documentation.animation: A big (640x640) animated variant of the photo in MPEG4 format; may be null
documentation.small_animation: A small (160x160) animated variant of the photo in MPEG4 format; may be null even the big animation is available

documentation.description: Contains a list of chat or user profile photos
documentation.total_count: Total number of photos

documentation.description: A previously used profile photo of the current user
documentation.chat_photo_id: Identifier of the current user's profile photo to reuse

documentation.description: A static photo in JPEG format
documentation.photo: Photo to be set as profile photo. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are allowed

documentation.description: An animation in MPEG4 format; must be square, at most 10 seconds long, have width between 160 and 800 and be at most 2MB in size
documentation.animation: Animation to be set as profile photo. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are allowed
documentation.main_frame_timestamp: Timestamp of the frame, which will be used as static chat photo

documentation.description: Describes actions that a user is allowed to take in a chat
documentation.can_send_messages: True, if the user can send text messages, contacts, locations, and venues
documentation.can_send_media_messages: True, if the user can send audio files, documents, photos, videos, video notes, and voice notes. Implies can_send_messages permissions
documentation.can_send_polls: True, if the user can send polls. Implies can_send_messages permissions
documentation.can_send_other_messages: True, if the user can send animations, games, stickers, and dice and use inline bots. Implies can_send_messages permissions
documentation.can_add_web_page_previews: True, if the user may add a web page preview to their messages. Implies can_send_messages permissions
documentation.can_change_info: True, if the user can change the chat title, photo, and other settings
documentation.can_invite_users: True, if the user can invite new users to the chat
documentation.can_pin_messages: True, if the user can pin messages

documentation.description: Describes rights of the administrator
documentation.can_manage_chat: True, if the administrator can get chat event log, get chat statistics, get message statistics in channels, get channel members, see anonymous administrators in supergroups and ignore slow mode. Implied by any other privilege; applicable to supergroups and channels only
documentation.can_change_info: True, if the administrator can change the chat title, photo, and other settings
documentation.can_post_messages: True, if the administrator can create channel posts; applicable to channels only
documentation.can_edit_messages: True, if the administrator can edit messages of other users and pin messages; applicable to channels only
documentation.can_delete_messages: True, if the administrator can delete messages of other users
documentation.can_invite_users: True, if the administrator can invite new users to the chat
documentation.can_restrict_members: True, if the administrator can restrict, ban, or unban chat members; always true for channels
documentation.can_pin_messages: True, if the administrator can pin messages; applicable to basic groups and supergroups only
documentation.can_promote_members: True, if the administrator can add new administrators with a subset of their own privileges or demote administrators that were directly or indirectly promoted by them
documentation.can_manage_video_chats: True, if the administrator can manage video chats
documentation.is_anonymous: True, if the administrator isn't shown in the chat member list and sends messages anonymously; applicable to supergroups only

documentation.description: Represents a user
documentation.id: User identifier
documentation.status: Current online status of the user
documentation.profile_photo: Profile photo of the user; may be null
documentation.is_contact: The user is a contact of the current user
documentation.is_mutual_contact: The user is a contact of the current user and the current user is a contact of the user
documentation.is_verified: True, if the user is verified
documentation.is_premium: True, if the user is a Telegram Premium user
documentation.is_support: True, if the user is Telegram support account
documentation.restriction_reason: If non-empty, it contains a human-readable description of the reason why access to this user must be restricted
documentation.is_scam: True, if many users reported this user as a scam
documentation.is_fake: True, if many users reported this user as a fake account
documentation.have_access: If false, the user is inaccessible, and the only information known about the user is inside this class. Identifier of the user can't be passed to any method except GetUser
documentation.language_code: IETF language tag of the user's language; only available to bots
documentation.added_to_attachment_menu: True, if the user added the current bot to attachment menu; only available to bots

documentation.description: Contains information about a bot
documentation.share_text: The text that is shown on the bot's profile page and is sent together with the link when users share the bot
documentation.param_description: The text shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty
documentation.photo: Photo shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty; may be null
documentation.animation: Animation shown in the chat with the bot if the chat is empty; may be null
documentation.menu_button: Information about a button to show instead of the bot commands menu button; may be null if ordinary bot commands menu must be shown
documentation.default_group_administrator_rights: Default administrator rights for adding the bot to basic group and supergroup chats; may be null
documentation.default_channel_administrator_rights: Default administrator rights for adding the bot to channels; may be null

documentation.description: Contains full information about a user
documentation.photo: User profile photo; may be null
documentation.is_blocked: True, if the user is blocked by the current user
documentation.can_be_called: True, if the user can be called
documentation.supports_video_calls: True, if a video call can be created with the user
documentation.has_private_calls: True, if the user can't be called due to their privacy settings
documentation.has_private_forwards: True, if the user can't be linked in forwarded messages due to their privacy settings
documentation.need_phone_number_privacy_exception: True, if the current user needs to explicitly allow to share their phone number with the user when the method addContact is used
documentation.bio: A short user bio; may be null for bots
documentation.group_in_common_count: Number of group chats where both the other user and the current user are a member; 0 for the current user
documentation.bot_info: For bots, information about the bot; may be null

documentation.description: Represents a list of users
documentation.total_count: Approximate total number of users found

documentation.description: Contains information about a chat administrator
documentation.is_owner: True, if the user is the owner of the chat

documentation.description: Represents a list of chat administrators
The user is the owner of the chat and has all the administrator privileges
documentation.custom_title: A custom title of the owner; 0-16 characters without emojis; applicable to supergroups only
documentation.is_anonymous: True, if the creator isn't shown in the chat member list and sends messages anonymously; applicable to supergroups only
documentation.is_member: True, if the user is a member of the chat

documentation.description: The user is a member of the chat and has some additional privileges. In basic groups, administrators can edit and delete messages sent by others, add new members, ban unprivileged members, and manage video chats. In supergroups and channels, there are more detailed options for administrator privileges
documentation.custom_title: A custom title of the administrator; 0-16 characters without emojis; applicable to supergroups only
documentation.can_be_edited: True, if the current user can edit the administrator privileges for the called user

documentation.description: The user is a member of the chat, without any additional privileges or restrictions
The user is under certain restrictions in the chat. Not supported in basic groups and channels
documentation.is_member: True, if the user is a member of the chat
documentation.restricted_until_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when restrictions will be lifted from the user; 0 if never. If the user is restricted for more than 366 days or for less than 30 seconds from the current time, the user is considered to be restricted forever

documentation.description: The user or the chat is not a chat member

The user or the chat was banned (and hence is not a member of the chat). Implies the user can't return to the chat, view messages, or be used as a participant identifier to join a video chat of the chat
documentation.banned_until_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user will be unbanned; 0 if never. If the user is banned for more than 366 days or for less than 30 seconds from the current time, the user is considered to be banned forever. Always 0 in basic groups

documentation.description: Describes a user or a chat as a member of another chat
documentation.member_id: Identifier of the chat member. Currently, other chats can be only Left or Banned. Only supergroups and channels can have other chats as Left or Banned members and these chats must be supergroups or channels
documentation.inviter_user_id: Identifier of a user that invited/promoted/banned this member in the chat; 0 if unknown
documentation.joined_chat_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user joined the chat
documentation.status: Status of the member in the chat

documentation.description: Contains a list of chat members
documentation.total_count: Approximate total number of chat members found

documentation.description: Returns contacts of the user
Returns the owner and administrators
Returns all chat members, including restricted chat members

documentation.key_hash: Hash of the currently used key for comparison with the hash of the chat partner's key. This is a string of 36 little-endian bytes, which must be split into groups of 2 bits, each denoting a pixel of one of 4 colors FFFFFF, D5E6F3, 2D5775, and 2F99C9. -The pixels must be used to make a 12x12 square image filled from left to right, top to bottom. Alternatively, the first 32 bytes of the hash can be converted to the hexadecimal format and printed as 32 2-digit hex numbers

documentation.description: The link is a link to the active sessions section of the application. Use getActiveSessions to handle the link

The link is a link to an attachment menu bot to be opened in the specified or a chosen chat. Process given target_chat to open the chat. -Then call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot and can be added to attachment menu. Then use getAttachmentMenuBot to receive information about the bot. -If the bot isn't added to attachment menu, then user needs to confirm adding the bot to attachment menu. If user confirms adding, then use toggleBotIsAddedToAttachmentMenu to add it. -If the attachment menu bot can't be used in the opened chat, show an error to the user. If the bot is added to attachment menu and can be used in the chat, then use openWebApp with the given URL
documentation.url: URL to be passed to openWebApp

documentation.description: The link contains an authentication code. Call checkAuthenticationCode with the code if the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode
The link is a link to a background. Call searchBackground with the given background name to process the link

The link is a link to a chat with a Telegram bot. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot, show START button in the chat with the bot, -and then call sendBotStartMessage with the given start parameter after the button is pressed
documentation.start_parameter: The parameter to be passed to sendBotStartMessage

documentation.description: The link is a link to a Telegram bot, which is supposed to be added to a group chat. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username, check that the user is a bot and can be added to groups, -ask the current user to select a basic group or a supergroup chat to add the bot to, taking into account that bots can be added to a public supergroup only by administrators of the supergroup. -If administrator rights are provided by the link, call getChatMember to receive the current bot rights in the chat and if the bot already is an administrator, -check that the current user can edit its administrator rights, combine received rights with the requested administrator rights, show confirmation box to the user, -and call setChatMemberStatus with the chosen chat and confirmed administrator rights. Before call to setChatMemberStatus it may be required to upgrade the chosen basic group chat to a supergroup chat. -Then if start_parameter isn't empty, call sendBotStartMessage with the given start parameter and the chosen chat, otherwise just send /start message with bot's username added to the chat.
documentation.start_parameter: The parameter to be passed to sendBotStartMessage
documentation.administrator_rights: Expected administrator rights for the bot; may be null

documentation.description: The link is a link to a Telegram bot, which is supposed to be added to a channel chat as an administrator. Call searchPublicChat with the given bot username and check that the user is a bot, -ask the current user to select a channel chat to add the bot to as an administrator. Then call getChatMember to receive the current bot rights in the chat and if the bot already is an administrator, -check that the current user can edit its administrator rights and combine received rights with the requested administrator rights. Then show confirmation box to the user, and call setChatMemberStatus with the chosen chat and confirmed rights
documentation.administrator_rights: Expected administrator rights for the bot

Returns the current authorization state; this is an offline request. For informational purposes only. Use updateAuthorizationState instead to maintain the current authorization state. Can be called before initialization
Sets the parameters for TDLib initialization. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitTdlibParameters
Checks the database encryption key for correctness. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitEncryptionKey
documentation.encryption_key: Encryption key to check or set up

documentation.description: Sets the phone number of the user and sends an authentication code to the user. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber, -or if there is no pending authentication query and the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode, authorizationStateWaitRegistration, or authorizationStateWaitPassword
documentation.phone_number: The phone number of the user, in international format
documentation.settings: Settings for the authentication of the user's phone number; pass null to use default settings

documentation.description: Re-sends an authentication code to the user. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode, the next_code_type of the result is not null and the server-specified timeout has passed
Checks the authentication code. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode

Requests QR code authentication by scanning a QR code on another logged in device. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber, -or if there is no pending authentication query and the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitCode, authorizationStateWaitRegistration, or authorizationStateWaitPassword
documentation.other_user_ids: List of user identifiers of other users currently using the application

documentation.description: Finishes user registration. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitRegistration
documentation.first_name: The first name of the user; 1-64 characters
documentation.last_name: The last name of the user; 0-64 characters

documentation.description: Checks the authentication password for correctness. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword
Requests to send a password recovery code to an email address that was previously set up. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword
Checks whether a password recovery code sent to an email address is valid. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword
Recovers the password with a password recovery code sent to an email address that was previously set up. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPassword
documentation.new_password: New password of the user; may be empty to remove the password
documentation.new_hint: New password hint; may be empty

documentation.description: Checks the authentication token of a bot; to log in as a bot. Works only when the current authorization state is authorizationStateWaitPhoneNumber. Can be used instead of setAuthenticationPhoneNumber and checkAuthenticationCode to log in

Closes the TDLib instance after a proper logout. Requires an available network connection. All local data will be destroyed. After the logout completes, updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent

Closes the TDLib instance. All databases will be flushed to disk and properly closed. After the close completes, updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent. Can be called before initialization

Closes the TDLib instance, destroying all local data without a proper logout. The current user session will remain in the list of all active sessions. All local data will be destroyed. After the destruction completes updateAuthorizationState with authorizationStateClosed will be sent. Can be called before authorization
Confirms QR code authentication on another device. Returns created session on success
documentation.link: A link from a QR code. The link must be scanned by the in-app camera

documentation.description: Returns all updates needed to restore current TDLib state, i.e. all actual UpdateAuthorizationState/UpdateUser/UpdateNewChat and others. This is especially useful if TDLib is run in a separate process. Can be called before initialization
Changes the database encryption key. Usually the encryption key is never changed and is stored in some OS keychain
Returns the current state of 2-step verification
Changes the password for the current user. If a new recovery email address is specified, then the change will not be applied until the new recovery email address is confirmed
documentation.new_password: New password of the user; may be empty to remove the password
documentation.new_hint: New password hint; may be empty
documentation.set_recovery_email_address: Pass true to change also the recovery email address
documentation.new_recovery_email_address: New recovery email address; may be empty

documentation.description: Returns a 2-step verification recovery email address that was previously set up. This method can be used to verify a password provided by the user
documentation.password: The password for the current user

documentation.description: Changes the 2-step verification recovery email address of the user. If a new recovery email address is specified, then the change will not be applied until the new recovery email address is confirmed. -If new_recovery_email_address is the same as the email address that is currently set up, this call succeeds immediately and aborts all other requests waiting for an email confirmation
Checks the 2-step verification recovery email address verification code
Resends the 2-step verification recovery email address verification code
Requests to send a 2-step verification password recovery code to an email address that was previously set up
Checks whether a 2-step verification password recovery code sent to an email address is valid
Recovers the 2-step verification password using a recovery code sent to an email address that was previously set up
documentation.new_password: New password of the user; may be empty to remove the password
documentation.new_hint: New password hint; may be empty

documentation.description: Removes 2-step verification password without previous password and access to recovery email address. The password can't be reset immediately and the request needs to be repeated after the specified time
Cancels reset of 2-step verification password. The method can be called if passwordState.pending_reset_date > 0
Creates a new temporary password for processing payments
documentation.valid_for: Time during which the temporary password will be valid, in seconds; must be between 60 and 86400

documentation.description: Returns information about the current temporary password
Returns the current user
Returns information about a user by their identifier. This is an offline request if the current user is not a bot
Returns full information about a user by their identifier
Returns information about a basic group by its identifier. This is an offline request if the current user is not a bot
Returns full information about a basic group by its identifier
Returns information about a supergroup or a channel by its identifier. This is an offline request if the current user is not a bot
Returns full information about a supergroup or a channel by its identifier, cached for up to 1 minute
Returns information about a secret chat by its identifier. This is an offline request
Returns information about a chat by its identifier, this is an offline request if the current user is not a bot
Returns information about a message
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message to get

documentation.description: Returns information about a message, if it is available without sending network request. This is an offline request
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message to get

documentation.description: Returns information about a message that is replied by a given message. Also returns the pinned message, the game message, and the invoice message for messages of the types messagePinMessage, messageGameScore, and messagePaymentSuccessful respectively
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

documentation.description: Returns information about a newest pinned message in the chat
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

documentation.description: Returns information about a message with the callback button that originated a callback query; for bots only
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the message belongs to

documentation.description: Returns information about messages. If a message is not found, returns null on the corresponding position of the result
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat the messages belong to
documentation.message_ids: Identifiers of the messages to get

documentation.description: Returns information about a message thread. Can be used only if message.can_get_message_thread == true

Returns viewers of a recent outgoing message in a basic group or a supergroup chat. For video notes and voice notes only users, opened content of the message, are returned. The method can be called if message.can_get_viewers == true
Returns information about a file; this is an offline request
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file to get

documentation.description: Returns information about a file by its remote ID; this is an offline request. Can be used to register a URL as a file for further uploading, or sending as a message. Even the request succeeds, the file can be used only if it is still accessible to the user. -For example, if the file is from a message, then the message must be not deleted and accessible to the user. If the file database is disabled, then the corresponding object with the file must be preloaded by the application
documentation.remote_file_id: Remote identifier of the file to get
documentation.file_type: File type; pass null if unknown

documentation.description: Loads more chats from a chat list. The loaded chats and their positions in the chat list will be sent through updates. Chats are sorted by the pair (chat.position.order, chat.id) in descending order. Returns a 404 error if all chats have been loaded
documentation.chat_list: The chat list in which to load chats; pass null to load chats from the main chat list
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be loaded. For optimal performance, the number of loaded chats is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the list is not reached

documentation.description: Returns an ordered list of chats from the beginning of a chat list. For informational purposes only. Use loadChats and updates processing instead to maintain chat lists in a consistent state
documentation.chat_list: The chat list in which to return chats; pass null to get chats from the main chat list
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned

documentation.description: Searches a public chat by its username. Currently, only private chats, supergroups and channels can be public. Returns the chat if found; otherwise an error is returned

Searches public chats by looking for specified query in their username and title. Currently, only private chats, supergroups and channels can be public. Returns a meaningful number of results. -Excludes private chats with contacts and chats from the chat list from the results
Searches for the specified query in the title and username of already known chats, this is an offline request. Returns chats in the order seen in the main chat list
documentation.query: Query to search for. If the query is empty, returns up to 50 recently found chats
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned

documentation.description: Searches for the specified query in the title and username of already known chats via request to the server. Returns chats in the order seen in the main chat list
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned

documentation.description: Returns a list of users and location-based supergroups nearby. The list of users nearby will be updated for 60 seconds after the request by the updates updateUsersNearby. The request must be sent again every 25 seconds with adjusted location to not miss new chats
Returns a list of frequently used chats. Supported only if the chat info database is enabled
documentation.category: Category of chats to be returned
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned; up to 30

documentation.description: Removes a chat from the list of frequently used chats. Supported only if the chat info database is enabled
Adds a chat to the list of recently found chats. The chat is added to the beginning of the list. If the chat is already in the list, it will be removed from the list first
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to add

documentation.description: Removes a chat from the list of recently found chats
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to be removed

documentation.description: Clears the list of recently found chats
Returns recently opened chats, this is an offline request. Returns chats in the order of last opening
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned

documentation.description: Checks whether a username can be set for a chat
documentation.chat_id: Chat identifier; must be identifier of a supergroup chat, or a channel chat, or a private chat with self, or zero if the chat is being created

documentation.description: Returns a list of public chats of the specified type, owned by the user
documentation.type: Type of the public chats to return

documentation.description: Checks whether the maximum number of owned public chats has been reached. Returns corresponding error if the limit was reached. The limit can be increased with Telegram Premium
documentation.type: Type of the public chats, for which to check the limit

documentation.description: Returns a list of basic group and supergroup chats, which can be used as a discussion group for a channel. Returned basic group chats must be first upgraded to supergroups before they can be set as a discussion group. To set a returned supergroup as a discussion group, access to its old messages must be enabled using toggleSupergroupIsAllHistoryAvailable first

Returns a list of recently inactive supergroups and channels. Can be used when user reaches limit on the number of joined supergroups and channels and receives CHANNELS_TOO_MUCH error. Also, the limit can be increased with Telegram Premium
Returns a list of common group chats with a given user. Chats are sorted by their type and creation date
documentation.offset_chat_id: Chat identifier starting from which to return chats; use 0 for the first request
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chats to be returned; up to 100

documentation.description: Returns messages in a chat. The messages are returned in a reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). -For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib. This is an offline request if only_local is true
documentation.from_message_id: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message
documentation.offset: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.only_local: Pass true to get only messages that are available without sending network requests

documentation.description: Returns messages in a message thread of a message. Can be used only if message.can_get_message_thread == true. Message thread of a channel message is in the channel's linked supergroup. -The messages are returned in a reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib
documentation.message_id: Message identifier, which thread history needs to be returned
documentation.from_message_id: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message
documentation.offset: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the from_message_id or a negative offset up to 99 to get additionally some newer messages
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than or equal to -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

documentation.description: Deletes all messages in the chat. Use chat.can_be_deleted_only_for_self and chat.can_be_deleted_for_all_users fields to find whether and how the method can be applied to the chat
documentation.remove_from_chat_list: Pass true to remove the chat from all chat lists
documentation.revoke: Pass true to delete chat history for all users

documentation.description: Deletes a chat along with all messages in the corresponding chat for all chat members. For group chats this will release the username and remove all members. Use the field chat.can_be_deleted_for_all_users to find whether the method can be applied to the chat

Searches for messages with given words in the chat. Returns the results in reverse chronological order, i.e. in order of decreasing message_id. Cannot be used in secret chats with a non-empty query -(searchSecretMessages must be used instead), or without an enabled message database. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat in which to search messages
documentation.sender_id: Identifier of the sender of messages to search for; pass null to search for messages from any sender. Not supported in secret chats
documentation.from_message_id: Identifier of the message starting from which history must be fetched; use 0 to get results from the last message
documentation.offset: Specify 0 to get results from exactly the from_message_id or a negative offset to get the specified message and some newer messages
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. If the offset is negative, the limit must be greater than -offset. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.filter: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, only messages in the specified thread will be returned; supergroups only

documentation.description: Searches for messages in all chats except secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing (date, chat_id, message_id)). -For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.chat_list: Chat list in which to search messages; pass null to search in all chats regardless of their chat list. Only Main and Archive chat lists are supported
documentation.offset_date: The date of the message starting from which the results need to be fetched. Use 0 or any date in the future to get results from the last message
documentation.offset_chat_id: The chat identifier of the last found message, or 0 for the first request
documentation.offset_message_id: The message identifier of the last found message, or 0 for the first request
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.filter: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages. Filters searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction, searchMessagesFilterFailedToSend, and searchMessagesFilterPinned are unsupported in this function
documentation.min_date: If not 0, the minimum date of the messages to return
documentation.max_date: If not 0, the maximum date of the messages to return

documentation.description: Searches for messages in secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat in which to search. Specify 0 to search in all secret chats
documentation.query: Query to search for. If empty, searchChatMessages must be used instead
documentation.offset: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.filter: Additional filter for messages to search; pass null to search for all messages

documentation.description: Searches for call messages. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i. e., in order of decreasing message_id). For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib
documentation.from_message_id: Identifier of the message from which to search; use 0 to get results from the last message
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit
documentation.only_missed: Pass true to search only for messages with missed/declined calls

documentation.description: Searches for outgoing messages with content of the type messageDocument in all chats except secret chats. Returns the results in reverse chronological order
documentation.query: Query to search for in document file name and message caption
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; up to 100

documentation.description: Deletes all call messages
documentation.revoke: Pass true to delete the messages for all users

documentation.description: Returns information about the recent locations of chat members that were sent to the chat. Returns up to 1 location message per user
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned

documentation.description: Returns all active live locations that need to be updated by the application. The list is persistent across application restarts only if the message database is used
Returns the last message sent in a chat no later than the specified date
documentation.date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) relative to which to search for messages

documentation.description: Returns sparse positions of messages of the specified type in the chat to be used for shared media scroll implementation. Returns the results in reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id). -Cannot be used in secret chats or with searchMessagesFilterFailedToSend filter without an enabled message database
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat in which to return information about message positions
documentation.filter: Filter for message content. Filters searchMessagesFilterEmpty, searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, and searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction are unsupported in this function
documentation.from_message_id: The message identifier from which to return information about message positions
documentation.limit: The expected number of message positions to be returned; 50-2000. A smaller number of positions can be returned, if there are not enough appropriate messages

documentation.description: Returns information about the next messages of the specified type in the chat split by days. Returns the results in reverse chronological order. Can return partial result for the last returned day. Behavior of this method depends on the value of the option "utc_time_offset"
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat in which to return information about messages
documentation.filter: Filter for message content. Filters searchMessagesFilterEmpty, searchMessagesFilterMention, searchMessagesFilterUnreadMention, and searchMessagesFilterUnreadReaction are unsupported in this function
documentation.from_message_id: The message identifier from which to return information about messages; use 0 to get results from the last message

documentation.description: Returns approximate number of messages of the specified type in the chat
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat in which to count messages
documentation.filter: Filter for message content; searchMessagesFilterEmpty is unsupported in this function
documentation.return_local: Pass true to get the number of messages without sending network requests, or -1 if the number of messages is unknown locally

documentation.description: Returns all scheduled messages in a chat. The messages are returned in a reverse chronological order (i.e., in order of decreasing message_id)
Returns forwarded copies of a channel message to different public channels. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib
documentation.offset: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results
documentation.limit: The maximum number of messages to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned messages is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit

documentation.description: Returns sponsored message to be shown in a chat; for channel chats only. Returns a 404 error if there is no sponsored message in the chat
Removes an active notification from notification list. Needs to be called only if the notification is removed by the current user
documentation.notification_group_id: Identifier of notification group to which the notification belongs

documentation.description: Removes a group of active notifications. Needs to be called only if the notification group is removed by the current user
documentation.max_notification_id: The maximum identifier of removed notifications

documentation.description: Returns an HTTPS link to a message in a chat. Available only for already sent messages in supergroups and channels, or if message.can_get_media_timestamp_links and a media timestamp link is generated. This is an offline request
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs
documentation.media_timestamp: If not 0, timestamp from which the video/audio/video note/voice note playing must start, in seconds. The media can be in the message content or in its web page preview
documentation.for_album: Pass true to create a link for the whole media album
documentation.for_comment: Pass true to create a link to the message as a channel post comment, or from a message thread

documentation.description: Returns an HTML code for embedding the message. Available only for messages in supergroups and channels with a username
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs
documentation.for_album: Pass true to return an HTML code for embedding of the whole media album

documentation.description: Returns information about a public or private message link. Can be called for any internal link of the type internalLinkTypeMessage
documentation.url: The message link

documentation.description: Translates a text to the given language. Returns a 404 error if the translation can't be performed
documentation.from_language_code: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code of the language from which the message is translated. If empty, the language will be detected automatically
documentation.to_language_code: A two-letter ISO 639-1 language code of the language to which the message is translated

documentation.description: Recognizes speech in a voice note message. The message must be successfully sent and must not be scheduled. May return an error with a message "MSG_VOICE_TOO_LONG" if the voice note is too long to be recognized
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

documentation.description: Rates recognized speech in a voice note message
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs
documentation.is_good: Pass true if the speech recognition is good

documentation.description: Returns list of message sender identifiers, which can be used to send messages in a chat
Selects a message sender to send messages in a chat
documentation.message_sender_id: New message sender for the chat

documentation.description: Sends a message. Returns the sent message
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, a message thread identifier in which the message will be sent
documentation.reply_to_message_id: Identifier of the replied message; 0 if none
documentation.options: Options to be used to send the message; pass null to use default options
documentation.reply_markup: Markup for replying to the message; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.input_message_content: The content of the message to be sent

documentation.description: Sends 2-10 messages grouped together into an album. Currently, only audio, document, photo and video messages can be grouped into an album. Documents and audio files can be only grouped in an album with messages of the same type. Returns sent messages
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, a message thread identifier in which the messages will be sent
documentation.reply_to_message_id: Identifier of a replied message; 0 if none
documentation.options: Options to be used to send the messages; pass null to use default options
documentation.input_message_contents: Contents of messages to be sent. At most 10 messages can be added to an album
documentation.only_preview: Pass true to get fake messages instead of actually sending them

documentation.description: Invites a bot to a chat (if it is not yet a member) and sends it the /start command. Bots can't be invited to a private chat other than the chat with the bot. Bots can't be invited to channels (although they can be added as admins) and secret chats. Returns the sent message
documentation.parameter: A hidden parameter sent to the bot for deep linking purposes (https://core.telegram.org/bots#deep-linking)

documentation.description: Sends the result of an inline query as a message. Returns the sent message. Always clears a chat draft message
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, a message thread identifier in which the message will be sent
documentation.reply_to_message_id: Identifier of a replied message; 0 if none
documentation.options: Options to be used to send the message; pass null to use default options
documentation.hide_via_bot: Pass true to hide the bot, via which the message is sent. Can be used only for bots GetOption("animation_search_bot_username"), GetOption("photo_search_bot_username"), and GetOption("venue_search_bot_username")

documentation.description: Forwards previously sent messages. Returns the forwarded messages in the same order as the message identifiers passed in message_ids. If a message can't be forwarded, null will be returned instead of the message
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which to forward messages
documentation.from_chat_id: Identifier of the chat from which to forward messages
documentation.message_ids: Identifiers of the messages to forward. Message identifiers must be in a strictly increasing order. At most 100 messages can be forwarded simultaneously
documentation.options: Options to be used to send the messages; pass null to use default options
documentation.send_copy: Pass true to copy content of the messages without reference to the original sender. Always true if the messages are forwarded to a secret chat or are local
documentation.remove_caption: Pass true to remove media captions of message copies. Ignored if send_copy is false
documentation.only_preview: Pass true to get fake messages instead of actually forwarding them

documentation.description: Resends messages which failed to send. Can be called only for messages for which messageSendingStateFailed.can_retry is true and after specified in messageSendingStateFailed.retry_after time passed. -If a message is re-sent, the corresponding failed to send message is deleted. Returns the sent messages in the same order as the message identifiers passed in message_ids. If a message can't be re-sent, null will be returned instead of the message
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to send messages
documentation.message_ids: Identifiers of the messages to resend. Message identifiers must be in a strictly increasing order

documentation.description: Sends a notification about a screenshot taken in a chat. Supported only in private and secret chats
Adds a local message to a chat. The message is persistent across application restarts only if the message database is used. Returns the added message
documentation.sender_id: Identifier of the sender of the message
documentation.reply_to_message_id: Identifier of the replied message; 0 if none
documentation.disable_notification: Pass true to disable notification for the message
documentation.input_message_content: The content of the message to be added

documentation.description: Deletes messages
documentation.message_ids: Identifiers of the messages to be deleted
documentation.revoke: Pass true to delete messages for all chat members. Always true for supergroups, channels and secret chats

documentation.description: Deletes all messages sent by the specified message sender in a chat. Supported only for supergroups; requires can_delete_messages administrator privileges
documentation.sender_id: Identifier of the sender of messages to delete

documentation.description: Deletes all messages between the specified dates in a chat. Supported only for private chats and basic groups. Messages sent in the last 30 seconds will not be deleted
documentation.min_date: The minimum date of the messages to delete
documentation.max_date: The maximum date of the messages to delete
documentation.revoke: Pass true to delete chat messages for all users; private chats only

documentation.description: Edits the text of a message (or a text of a game message). Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.input_message_content: New text content of the message. Must be of type inputMessageText

documentation.description: Edits the message content of a live location. Messages can be edited for a limited period of time specified in the live location. Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.location: New location content of the message; pass null to stop sharing the live location
documentation.heading: The new direction in which the location moves, in degrees; 1-360. Pass 0 if unknown
documentation.proximity_alert_radius: The new maximum distance for proximity alerts, in meters (0-100000). Pass 0 if the notification is disabled

documentation.description: Edits the content of a message with an animation, an audio, a document, a photo or a video, including message caption. If only the caption needs to be edited, use editMessageCaption instead. -The media can't be edited if the message was set to self-destruct or to a self-destructing media. The type of message content in an album can't be changed with exception of replacing a photo with a video or vice versa. Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.input_message_content: New content of the message. Must be one of the following types: inputMessageAnimation, inputMessageAudio, inputMessageDocument, inputMessagePhoto or inputMessageVideo

documentation.description: Edits the message content caption. Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.caption: New message content caption; 0-GetOption("message_caption_length_max") characters; pass null to remove caption

documentation.description: Edits the message reply markup; for bots only. Returns the edited message after the edit is completed on the server side
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none

documentation.description: Edits the text of an inline text or game message sent via a bot; for bots only
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none
documentation.input_message_content: New text content of the message. Must be of type inputMessageText

documentation.description: Edits the content of a live location in an inline message sent via a bot; for bots only
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none
documentation.location: New location content of the message; pass null to stop sharing the live location
documentation.heading: The new direction in which the location moves, in degrees; 1-360. Pass 0 if unknown
documentation.proximity_alert_radius: The new maximum distance for proximity alerts, in meters (0-100000). Pass 0 if the notification is disabled

documentation.description: Edits the content of a message with an animation, an audio, a document, a photo or a video in an inline message sent via a bot; for bots only
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only
documentation.input_message_content: New content of the message. Must be one of the following types: inputMessageAnimation, inputMessageAudio, inputMessageDocument, inputMessagePhoto or inputMessageVideo

documentation.description: Edits the caption of an inline message sent via a bot; for bots only
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none
documentation.caption: New message content caption; pass null to remove caption; 0-GetOption("message_caption_length_max") characters

documentation.description: Edits the reply markup of an inline message sent via a bot; for bots only
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none

documentation.description: Edits the time when a scheduled message will be sent. Scheduling state of all messages in the same album or forwarded together with the message will be also changed
documentation.chat_id: The chat the message belongs to
documentation.scheduling_state: The new message scheduling state; pass null to send the message immediately

documentation.description: Returns reactions, which can be added to a message. The method will return Premium reactions, even the current user has no Premium subscription

documentation.description: Changes chosen reaction for a message
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs

documentation.is_big: Pass true if the reaction is added with a big animation
