documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the message belongs
documentation.reaction: If non-empty, only added reactions with the specified text representation will be returned
documentation.offset: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results
documentation.limit: The maximum number of reactions to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 100

documentation.description: Returns all entities (mentions, hashtags, cashtags, bot commands, bank card numbers, URLs, and email addresses) contained in the text. Can be called synchronously
documentation.text: The text in which to look for entites

documentation.description: Parses Bold, Italic, Underline, Strikethrough, Spoiler, Code, Pre, PreCode, TextUrl and MentionName entities contained in the text. Can be called synchronously
Parses Markdown entities in a human-friendly format, ignoring markup errors. Can be called synchronously
documentation.text: The text to parse. For example, "__italic__ ~~strikethrough~~ ||spoiler|| **bold** `code` ```pre``` __[italic__ text_url](telegram.org) __italic**bold italic__bold**"

documentation.description: Replaces text entities with Markdown formatting in a human-friendly format. Entities that can't be represented in Markdown unambiguously are kept as is. Can be called synchronously
Returns the MIME type of a file, guessed by its extension. Returns an empty string on failure. Can be called synchronously
documentation.file_name: The name of the file or path to the file

documentation.description: Returns the extension of a file, guessed by its MIME type. Returns an empty string on failure. Can be called synchronously
documentation.mime_type: The MIME type of the file

documentation.description: Removes potentially dangerous characters from the name of a file. The encoding of the file name is supposed to be UTF-8. Returns an empty string on failure. Can be called synchronously
documentation.file_name: File name or path to the file

documentation.description: Returns a string stored in the local database from the specified localization target and language pack by its key. Returns a 404 error if the string is not found. Can be called synchronously

documentation.localization_target: Localization target to which the language pack belongs
documentation.key: Language pack key of the string to be returned

Converts a JsonValue object to corresponding JSON-serialized string. Can be called synchronously
Converts a themeParameters object to corresponding JSON-serialized string. Can be called synchronously

documentation.description: Changes the user answer to a poll. A poll in quiz mode can be answered only once
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the poll belongs
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message containing the poll
documentation.option_ids: 0-based identifiers of answer options, chosen by the user. User can choose more than 1 answer option only is the poll allows multiple answers

documentation.description: Returns users voted for the specified option in a non-anonymous polls. For optimal performance, the number of returned users is chosen by TDLib
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the poll belongs
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message containing the poll
documentation.offset: Number of users to skip in the result; must be non-negative
documentation.limit: The maximum number of users to be returned; must be positive and can't be greater than 50. For optimal performance, the number of returned users is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the voter list has not been reached

documentation.description: Stops a poll. A poll in a message can be stopped when the message has can_be_edited flag set
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat to which the poll belongs
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message containing the poll
documentation.reply_markup: The new message reply markup; pass null if none; for bots only

documentation.description: Hides a suggested action
Returns information about a button of type inlineKeyboardButtonTypeLoginUrl. The method needs to be called when the user presses the button
documentation.chat_id: Chat identifier of the message with the button
documentation.message_id: Message identifier of the message with the button

documentation.description: Returns an HTTP URL which can be used to automatically authorize the user on a website after clicking an inline button of type inlineKeyboardButtonTypeLoginUrl. -Use the method getLoginUrlInfo to find whether a prior user confirmation is needed. If an error is returned, then the button must be handled as an ordinary URL button
documentation.chat_id: Chat identifier of the message with the button
documentation.message_id: Message identifier of the message with the button
documentation.allow_write_access: Pass true to allow the bot to send messages to the current user

documentation.description: Sends an inline query to a bot and returns its results. Returns an error with code 502 if the bot fails to answer the query before the query timeout expires
documentation.bot_user_id: The identifier of the target bot
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat where the query was sent
documentation.user_location: Location of the user; pass null if unknown or the bot doesn't need user's location
documentation.offset: Offset of the first entry to return

documentation.description: Sets the result of an inline query; for bots only

documentation.cache_time: Allowed time to cache the results of the query, in seconds
documentation.next_offset: Offset for the next inline query; pass an empty string if there are no more results
documentation.switch_pm_text: If non-empty, this text must be shown on the button that opens a private chat with the bot and sends a start message to the bot with the parameter switch_pm_parameter
documentation.switch_pm_parameter: The parameter for the bot start message

documentation.theme: Preferred Web App theme; pass null to use the default theme

documentation.description: Sends data received from a keyboardButtonTypeWebApp Web App to a bot

documentation.bot_user_id: Identifier of the bot, providing the Web App
documentation.url: The URL from an inlineKeyboardButtonTypeWebApp button, a botMenuButton button, or an internalLinkTypeAttachmentMenuBot link, or an empty string otherwise
documentation.theme: Preferred Web App theme; pass null to use the default theme

documentation.web_app_query_id: Identifier of the Web App query

documentation.description: Sends a callback query to a bot and returns an answer. Returns an error with code 502 if the bot fails to answer the query before the query timeout expires
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of the chat with the message
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message from which the query originated

documentation.description: Sets the result of a callback query; for bots only
documentation.show_alert: Pass true to show an alert to the user instead of a toast notification
documentation.url: URL to be opened
documentation.cache_time: Time during which the result of the query can be cached, in seconds

documentation.description: Sets the result of a shipping query; for bots only
documentation.error_message: An error message, empty on success

documentation.description: Sets the result of a pre-checkout query; for bots only
documentation.error_message: An error message, empty on success

documentation.description: Updates the game score of the specified user in the game; for bots only
documentation.chat_id: The chat to which the message with the game belongs
documentation.edit_message: Pass true to edit the game message to include the current scoreboard
documentation.force: Pass true to update the score even if it decreases. If the score is 0, the user will be deleted from the high score table

documentation.description: Updates the game score of the specified user in a game; for bots only
documentation.edit_message: Pass true to edit the game message to include the current scoreboard
documentation.force: Pass true to update the score even if it decreases. If the score is 0, the user will be deleted from the high score table

documentation.description: Returns the high scores for a game and some part of the high score table in the range of the specified user; for bots only
documentation.chat_id: The chat that contains the message with the game

documentation.description: Returns game high scores and some part of the high score table in the range of the specified user; for bots only
Deletes the default reply markup from a chat. Must be called after a one-time keyboard or a ForceReply reply markup has been used. UpdateChatReplyMarkup will be sent if the reply markup is changed
documentation.message_id: The message identifier of the used keyboard

documentation.description: Sends a notification about user activity in a chat
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, a message thread identifier in which the action was performed
documentation.action: The action description; pass null to cancel the currently active action

Informs TDLib that the chat is closed by the user. Many useful activities depend on the chat being opened or closed

Informs TDLib that messages are being viewed by the user. Sponsored messages must be marked as viewed only when the entire text of the message is shown on the screen (excluding the button). Many useful activities depend on whether the messages are currently being viewed or not (e.g., marking messages as read, incrementing a view counter, updating a view counter, removing deleted messages in supergroups and channels)
documentation.message_thread_id: If not 0, a message thread identifier in which the messages are being viewed

documentation.message_id: Identifier of the message with the opened content

documentation.description: Informs TDLib that a message with an animated emoji was clicked by the user. Returns a big animated sticker to be played or a 404 error if usual animation needs to be played
Returns information about the type of an internal link. Returns a 404 error if the link is not internal. Can be called before authorization
Returns information about an action to be done when the current user clicks an external link. Don't use this method for links from secret chats if web page preview is disabled in secret chats

Returns an HTTP URL which can be used to automatically authorize the current user on a website after clicking an HTTP link. Use the method getExternalLinkInfo to find whether a prior user confirmation is needed
documentation.allow_write_access: Pass true if the current user allowed the bot, returned in getExternalLinkInfo, to send them messages

documentation.description: Marks all mentions in a chat as read
Marks all reactions in a chat as read
Returns an existing chat corresponding to a given user
documentation.force: Pass true to create the chat without a network request. In this case all information about the chat except its type, title and photo can be incorrect

documentation.description: Returns an existing chat corresponding to a known basic group
documentation.force: Pass true to create the chat without a network request. In this case all information about the chat except its type, title and photo can be incorrect

documentation.description: Returns an existing chat corresponding to a known supergroup or channel
documentation.force: Pass true to create the chat without a network request. In this case all information about the chat except its type, title and photo can be incorrect

documentation.chat_list: The chat list. Use getChatListsToAddChat to get suitable chat lists

documentation.description: Returns information about a chat filter by its identifier

Changes the order of chat filters

documentation.description: Changes the chat theme. Supported only in private and secret chats
documentation.theme_name: Name of the new chat theme; pass an empty string to return the default theme

Changes the value of the default disable_notification parameter, used when a message is sent to a chat

Changes the discussion group of a channel chat; requires can_change_info administrator right in the channel if it is specified

documentation.description: Changes the location of a chat. Available only for some location-based supergroups, use supergroupFullInfo.can_set_location to check whether the method is allowed to use
documentation.location: New location for the chat; must be valid and not null

documentation.description: Changes the slow mode delay of a chat. Available only for supergroups; requires can_restrict_members rights
documentation.slow_mode_delay: New slow mode delay for the chat, in seconds; must be one of 0, 10, 30, 60, 300, 900, 3600

documentation.description: Pins a message in a chat; requires can_pin_messages rights or can_edit_messages rights in the channel
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the new pinned message
documentation.disable_notification: Pass true to disable notification about the pinned message. Notifications are always disabled in channels and private chats
documentation.only_for_self: Pass true to pin the message only for self; private chats only

documentation.description: Removes a pinned message from a chat; requires can_pin_messages rights in the group or can_edit_messages rights in the channel
documentation.message_id: Identifier of the removed pinned message

documentation.description: Removes all pinned messages from a chat; requires can_pin_messages rights in the group or can_edit_messages rights in the channel

Adds the current user as a new member to a chat. Private and secret chats can't be joined using this method. May return an error with a message "INVITE_REQUEST_SENT" if only a join request was created
Removes the current user from chat members. Private and secret chats can't be left using this method
Adds a new member to a chat. Members can't be added to private or secret chats
documentation.forward_limit: The number of earlier messages from the chat to be forwarded to the new member; up to 100. Ignored for supergroups and channels, or if the added user is a bot

documentation.description: Adds multiple new members to a chat. Currently, this method is only available for supergroups and channels. This method can't be used to join a chat. Members can't be added to a channel if it has more than 200 members
documentation.user_ids: Identifiers of the users to be added to the chat. The maximum number of added users is 20 for supergroups and 100 for channels

documentation.description: Changes the status of a chat member, needs appropriate privileges. This function is currently not suitable for transferring chat ownership; use transferChatOwnership instead. Use addChatMember or banChatMember if some additional parameters needs to be passed
documentation.member_id: Member identifier. Chats can be only banned and unbanned in supergroups and channels
documentation.status: The new status of the member in the chat

documentation.description: Bans a member in a chat. Members can't be banned in private or secret chats. In supergroups and channels, the user will not be able to return to the group on their own using invite links, etc., unless unbanned first
documentation.banned_until_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the user will be unbanned; 0 if never. If the user is banned for more than 366 days or for less than 30 seconds from the current time, the user is considered to be banned forever. Ignored in basic groups and if a chat is banned
documentation.revoke_messages: Pass true to delete all messages in the chat for the user that is being removed. Always true for supergroups and channels

documentation.description: Checks whether the current session can be used to transfer a chat ownership to another user

Changes the owner of a chat. The current user must be a current owner of the chat. Use the method canTransferOwnership to check whether the ownership can be transferred from the current session. Available only for supergroups and channel chats
documentation.user_id: Identifier of the user to which transfer the ownership. The ownership can't be transferred to a bot or to a deleted user
documentation.password: The password of the current user

documentation.description: Returns information about a single member of a chat
Searches for a specified query in the first name, last name and username of the members of a specified chat. Requires administrator rights in channels
documentation.limit: The maximum number of users to be returned; up to 200
documentation.filter: The type of users to search for; pass null to search among all chat members

documentation.description: Returns a list of administrators of the chat with their custom titles
Clears message drafts in all chats
documentation.exclude_secret_chats: Pass true to keep local message drafts in secret chats

documentation.description: Returns saved notification sound by its identifier. Returns a 404 error if there is no saved notification sound with the specified identifier
Returns list of saved notification sounds. If a sound isn't in the list, then default sound needs to be used
Adds a new notification sound to the list of saved notification sounds. The new notification sound is added to the top of the list. If it is already in the list, its position isn't changed
Removes a notification sound from the list of saved notification sounds
Returns list of chats with non-default notification settings
documentation.scope: If specified, only chats from the scope will be returned; pass null to return chats from all scopes
documentation.compare_sound: Pass true to include in the response chats with only non-default sound

documentation.description: Returns the notification settings for chats of a given type
documentation.scope: Types of chats for which to return the notification settings information

documentation.description: Changes notification settings for chats of a given type
documentation.scope: Types of chats for which to change the notification settings
documentation.notification_settings: The new notification settings for the given scope

documentation.description: Resets all notification settings to their default values. By default, all chats are unmuted and message previews are shown

Changes the pinned state of a chat. There can be up to GetOption("pinned_chat_count_max")/GetOption("pinned_archived_chat_count_max") pinned non-secret chats and the same number of secret chats in the main/archive chat list. The limit can be increased with Telegram Premium
documentation.chat_list: Chat list in which to change the pinned state of the chat
documentation.is_pinned: Pass true to pin the chat; pass false to unpin it

documentation.description: Changes the order of pinned chats
documentation.chat_list: Chat list in which to change the order of pinned chats
documentation.chat_ids: The new list of pinned chats

documentation.description: Returns information about a bot that can be added to attachment menu
Adds or removes a bot to attachment menu. Bot can be added to attachment menu, only if userTypeBot.can_be_added_to_attachment_menu == true
documentation.is_added: Pass true to add the bot to attachment menu; pass false to remove the bot from attachment menu

documentation.description: Downloads a file from the cloud. Download progress and completion of the download will be notified through updateFile updates
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file to download
documentation.priority: Priority of the download (1-32). The higher the priority, the earlier the file will be downloaded. If the priorities of two files are equal, then the last one for which downloadFile/addFileToDownloads was called will be downloaded first
documentation.offset: The starting position from which the file needs to be downloaded
documentation.limit: Number of bytes which need to be downloaded starting from the "offset" position before the download will automatically be canceled; use 0 to download without a limit
documentation.synchronous: Pass true to return response only after the file download has succeeded, has failed, has been canceled, or a new downloadFile request with different offset/limit parameters was sent; pass false to return file state immediately, just after the download has been started

documentation.description: Stops the downloading of a file. If a file has already been downloaded, does nothing
documentation.file_id: Identifier of a file to stop downloading
documentation.only_if_pending: Pass true to stop downloading only if it hasn't been started, i.e. request hasn't been sent to server

documentation.description: Returns suggested name for saving a file in a given directory
documentation.directory: Directory in which the file is supposed to be saved

documentation.description: Asynchronously uploads a file to the cloud without sending it in a message. updateFile will be used to notify about upload progress and successful completion of the upload. The file will not have a persistent remote identifier until it will be sent in a message
documentation.file_type: File type; pass null if unknown
documentation.priority: Priority of the upload (1-32). The higher the priority, the earlier the file will be uploaded. If the priorities of two files are equal, then the first one for which uploadFile was called will be uploaded first

documentation.description: Stops the uploading of a file. Supported only for files uploaded by using uploadFile. For other files the behavior is undefined
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file to stop uploading

documentation.description: Writes a part of a generated file. This method is intended to be used only if the application has no direct access to TDLib's file system, because it is usually slower than a direct write to the destination file
documentation.generation_id: The identifier of the generation process
documentation.offset: The offset from which to write the data to the file

documentation.description: Informs TDLib on a file generation progress
documentation.generation_id: The identifier of the generation process
documentation.expected_size: Expected size of the generated file, in bytes; 0 if unknown
documentation.local_prefix_size: The number of bytes already generated

documentation.description: Finishes the file generation
documentation.generation_id: The identifier of the generation process
documentation.error: If passed, the file generation has failed and must be terminated; pass null if the file generation succeeded

documentation.description: Reads a part of a file from the TDLib file cache and returns read bytes. This method is intended to be used only if the application has no direct access to TDLib's file system, because it is usually slower than a direct read from the file
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file. The file must be located in the TDLib file cache
documentation.offset: The offset from which to read the file
documentation.count: Number of bytes to read. An error will be returned if there are not enough bytes available in the file from the specified position. Pass 0 to read all available data from the specified position

documentation.description: Deletes a file from the TDLib file cache
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file to delete

documentation.description: Adds a file from a message to the list of file downloads. Download progress and completion of the download will be notified through updateFile updates. -If message database is used, the list of file downloads is persistent across application restarts. The downloading is independent from download using downloadFile, i.e. it continues if downloadFile is canceled or is used to download a part of the file
documentation.file_id: Identifier of the file to download
documentation.chat_id: Chat identifier of the message with the file
documentation.priority: Priority of the download (1-32). The higher the priority, the earlier the file will be downloaded. If the priorities of two files are equal, then the last one for which downloadFile/addFileToDownloads was called will be downloaded first

documentation.description: Changes pause state of a file in the file download list
documentation.is_paused: Pass true if the download is paused

documentation.description: Changes pause state of all files in the file download list
documentation.are_paused: Pass true to pause all downloads; pass false to unpause them

documentation.description: Removes a file from the file download list
documentation.delete_from_cache: Pass true to delete the file from the TDLib file cache

documentation.description: Removes all files from the file download list
documentation.only_active: Pass true to remove only active downloads, including paused
documentation.only_completed: Pass true to remove only completed downloads
documentation.delete_from_cache: Pass true to delete the file from the TDLib file cache

documentation.description: Searches for files in the file download list or recently downloaded files from the list
documentation.query: Query to search for; may be empty to return all downloaded files
documentation.only_active: Pass true to search only for active downloads, including paused
documentation.only_completed: Pass true to search only for completed downloads
documentation.offset: Offset of the first entry to return as received from the previous request; use empty string to get the first chunk of results
documentation.limit: The maximum number of files to be returned

documentation.description: Returns information about a file with messages exported from another application
documentation.message_file_head: Beginning of the message file; up to 100 first lines

documentation.description: Returns a confirmation text to be shown to the user before starting message import
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of a chat to which the messages will be imported. It must be an identifier of a private chat with a mutual contact or an identifier of a supergroup chat with can_change_info administrator right

documentation.description: Imports messages exported from another app
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of a chat to which the messages will be imported. It must be an identifier of a private chat with a mutual contact or an identifier of a supergroup chat with can_change_info administrator right
documentation.message_file: File with messages to import. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are supported. The file must not be previously uploaded
documentation.attached_files: Files used in the imported messages. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are supported. The files must not be previously uploaded

documentation.description: Replaces current primary invite link for a chat with a new primary invite link. Available for basic groups, supergroups, and channels. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right
Creates a new invite link for a chat. Available for basic groups, supergroups, and channels. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat
documentation.name: Invite link name; 0-32 characters
documentation.expiration_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire; pass 0 if never
documentation.member_limit: The maximum number of chat members that can join the chat via the link simultaneously; 0-99999; pass 0 if not limited
documentation.creates_join_request: Pass true if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators. In this case, member_limit must be 0

documentation.description: Edits a non-primary invite link for a chat. Available for basic groups, supergroups, and channels. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links
documentation.name: Invite link name; 0-32 characters
documentation.expiration_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the link will expire; pass 0 if never
documentation.member_limit: The maximum number of chat members that can join the chat via the link simultaneously; 0-99999; pass 0 if not limited
documentation.creates_join_request: Pass true if users joining the chat via the link need to be approved by chat administrators. In this case, member_limit must be 0

documentation.description: Returns information about an invite link. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat to get own links and owner privileges to get other links
Returns list of chat administrators with number of their invite links. Requires owner privileges in the chat
Returns invite links for a chat created by specified administrator. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat to get own links and owner privileges to get other links
documentation.creator_user_id: User identifier of a chat administrator. Must be an identifier of the current user for non-owner
documentation.is_revoked: Pass true if revoked links needs to be returned instead of active or expired
documentation.offset_date: Creation date of an invite link starting after which to return invite links; use 0 to get results from the beginning
documentation.offset_invite_link: Invite link starting after which to return invite links; use empty string to get results from the beginning
documentation.limit: The maximum number of invite links to return; up to 100

documentation.description: Returns chat members joined a chat via an invite link. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links
documentation.invite_link: Invite link for which to return chat members
documentation.offset_member: A chat member from which to return next chat members; pass null to get results from the beginning
documentation.limit: The maximum number of chat members to return; up to 100

documentation.description: Revokes invite link for a chat. Available for basic groups, supergroups, and channels. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links. -If a primary link is revoked, then additionally to the revoked link returns new primary link
Deletes revoked chat invite links. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links

Deletes all revoked chat invite links created by a given chat administrator. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links
documentation.creator_user_id: User identifier of a chat administrator, which links will be deleted. Must be an identifier of the current user for non-owner

documentation.description: Checks the validity of an invite link for a chat and returns information about the corresponding chat
Uses an invite link to add the current user to the chat if possible. May return an error with a message "INVITE_REQUEST_SENT" if only a join request was created
Returns pending join requests in a chat
documentation.invite_link: Invite link for which to return join requests. If empty, all join requests will be returned. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links
documentation.query: A query to search for in the first names, last names and usernames of the users to return
documentation.offset_request: A chat join request from which to return next requests; pass null to get results from the beginning
documentation.limit: The maximum number of requests to join the chat to return

documentation.description: Handles a pending join request in a chat
documentation.user_id: Identifier of the user that sent the request
documentation.approve: Pass true to approve the request; pass false to decline it

documentation.description: Handles all pending join requests for a given link in a chat
documentation.invite_link: Invite link for which to process join requests. If empty, all join requests will be processed. Requires administrator privileges and can_invite_users right in the chat for own links and owner privileges for other links
documentation.approve: Pass true to approve all requests; pass false to decline them

documentation.description: Creates a new call
documentation.user_id: Identifier of the user to be called
documentation.protocol: The call protocols supported by the application
documentation.is_video: Pass true to create a video call

documentation.description: Accepts an incoming call
documentation.protocol: The call protocols supported by the application

documentation.description: Sends call signaling data
Discards a call
documentation.is_disconnected: Pass true if the user was disconnected
documentation.is_video: Pass true if the call was a video call
documentation.connection_id: Identifier of the connection used during the call

documentation.description: Sends a call rating
documentation.comment: An optional user comment if the rating is less than 5
documentation.problems: List of the exact types of problems with the call, specified by the user

documentation.description: Sends debug information for a call to Telegram servers
Sends log file for a call to Telegram servers
documentation.log_file: Call log file. Only inputFileLocal and inputFileGenerated are supported

documentation.description: Returns list of participant identifiers, on whose behalf a video chat in the chat can be joined
Changes default participant identifier, on whose behalf a video chat in the chat will be joined
documentation.default_participant_id: Default group call participant identifier to join the video chats

documentation.description: Creates a video chat (a group call bound to a chat). Available only for basic groups, supergroups and channels; requires can_manage_video_chats rights
documentation.chat_id: Identifier of a chat in which the video chat will be created
documentation.title: Group call title; if empty, chat title will be used
documentation.start_date: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when the group call is supposed to be started by an administrator; 0 to start the video chat immediately. The date must be at least 10 seconds and at most 8 days in the future
documentation.is_rtmp_stream: Pass true to create an RTMP stream instead of an ordinary video chat; requires creator privileges

documentation.description: Returns RTMP URL for streaming to the chat; requires creator privileges
Replaces the current RTMP URL for streaming to the chat; requires creator privileges
Returns information about a group call
Starts a scheduled group call
Toggles whether the current user will receive a notification when the group call will start; scheduled group calls only
documentation.enabled_start_notification: New value of the enabled_start_notification setting

documentation.description: Joins an active group call. Returns join response payload for tgcalls
documentation.participant_id: Identifier of a group call participant, which will be used to join the call; pass null to join as self; video chats only
documentation.audio_source_id: Caller audio channel synchronization source identifier; received from tgcalls
documentation.payload: Group call join payload; received from tgcalls
documentation.is_muted: Pass true to join the call with muted microphone
documentation.is_my_video_enabled: Pass true if the user's video is enabled
documentation.invite_hash: If non-empty, invite hash to be used to join the group call without being muted by administrators

documentation.description: Starts screen sharing in a joined group call. Returns join response payload for tgcalls
documentation.audio_source_id: Screen sharing audio channel synchronization source identifier; received from tgcalls
documentation.payload: Group call join payload; received from tgcalls

documentation.description: Pauses or unpauses screen sharing in a joined group call
documentation.is_paused: True if screen sharing is paused

documentation.description: Ends screen sharing in a joined group call
Sets group call title. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag
documentation.title: New group call title; 1-64 characters

documentation.description: Toggles whether new participants of a group call can be unmuted only by administrators of the group call. Requires groupCall.can_toggle_mute_new_participants group call flag
documentation.mute_new_participants: New value of the mute_new_participants setting

documentation.description: Invites users to an active group call. Sends a service message of type messageInviteToGroupCall for video chats
documentation.user_ids: User identifiers. At most 10 users can be invited simultaneously

documentation.description: Returns invite link to a video chat in a public chat
documentation.can_self_unmute: Pass true if the invite link needs to contain an invite hash, passing which to joinGroupCall would allow the invited user to unmute themselves. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag

documentation.description: Revokes invite link for a group call. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag
Starts recording of an active group call. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag
documentation.title: Group call recording title; 0-64 characters
documentation.record_video: Pass true to record a video file instead of an audio file
documentation.use_portrait_orientation: Pass true to use portrait orientation for video instead of landscape one

documentation.description: Ends recording of an active group call. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag
Toggles whether current user's video is paused
documentation.is_my_video_paused: Pass true if the current user's video is paused

documentation.description: Toggles whether current user's video is enabled
documentation.is_my_video_enabled: Pass true if the current user's video is enabled

documentation.description: Informs TDLib that speaking state of a participant of an active group has changed
documentation.audio_source: Group call participant's synchronization audio source identifier, or 0 for the current user
documentation.is_speaking: Pass true if the user is speaking

documentation.description: Toggles whether a participant of an active group call is muted, unmuted, or allowed to unmute themselves
documentation.is_muted: Pass true to mute the user; pass false to unmute the them

documentation.description: Changes volume level of a participant of an active group call. If the current user can manage the group call, then the participant's volume level will be changed for all users with the default volume level
documentation.volume_level: New participant's volume level; 1-20000 in hundreds of percents

documentation.description: Toggles whether a group call participant hand is rased
documentation.is_hand_raised: Pass true if the user's hand needs to be raised. Only self hand can be raised. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed group call flag to lower other's hand

documentation.description: Loads more participants of a group call. The loaded participants will be received through updates. Use the field groupCall.loaded_all_participants to check whether all participants have already been loaded
documentation.group_call_id: Group call identifier. The group call must be previously received through getGroupCall and must be joined or being joined
documentation.limit: The maximum number of participants to load; up to 100

documentation.description: Leaves a group call
Ends a group call. Requires groupCall.can_be_managed
Returns information about available group call streams
Returns a file with a segment of a group call stream in a modified OGG format for audio or MPEG-4 format for video
documentation.time_offset: Point in time when the stream segment begins; Unix timestamp in milliseconds
documentation.scale: Segment duration scale; 0-1. Segment's duration is 1000/(2**scale) milliseconds
documentation.channel_id: Identifier of an audio/video channel to get as received from tgcalls
documentation.video_quality: Video quality as received from tgcalls; pass null to get the worst available quality

documentation.description: Changes the block state of a message sender. Currently, only users and supergroup chats can be blocked
documentation.sender_id: Identifier of a message sender to block/unblock

documentation.description: Blocks an original sender of a message in the Replies chat
documentation.message_id: The identifier of an incoming message in the Replies chat
documentation.delete_message: Pass true to delete the message
documentation.delete_all_messages: Pass true to delete all messages from the same sender
documentation.report_spam: Pass true to report the sender to the Telegram moderators

documentation.description: Returns users and chats that were blocked by the current user
documentation.offset: Number of users and chats to skip in the result; must be non-negative
documentation.limit: The maximum number of users and chats to return; up to 100

documentation.description: Adds a user to the contact list or edits an existing contact by their user identifier
documentation.contact: The contact to add or edit; phone number may be empty and needs to be specified only if known, vCard is ignored
documentation.share_phone_number: Pass true to share the current user's phone number with the new contact. A corresponding rule to userPrivacySettingShowPhoneNumber will be added if needed. Use the field userFullInfo.need_phone_number_privacy_exception to check whether the current user needs to be asked to share their phone number

documentation.description: Adds new contacts or edits existing contacts by their phone numbers; contacts' user identifiers are ignored
documentation.contacts: The list of contacts to import or edit; contacts' vCard are ignored and are not imported

documentation.description: Returns all user contacts
Searches for the specified query in the first names, last names and usernames of the known user contacts
documentation.query: Query to search for; may be empty to return all contacts
documentation.limit: The maximum number of users to be returned

documentation.description: Removes users from the contact list
documentation.user_ids: Identifiers of users to be deleted

documentation.description: Returns the total number of imported contacts

Changes imported contacts using the list of contacts saved on the device. Imports newly added contacts and, if at least the file database is enabled, deletes recently deleted contacts. -Query result depends on the result of the previous query, so only one query is possible at the same time
documentation.contacts: The new list of contacts, contact's vCard are ignored and are not imported

documentation.description: Clears all imported contacts, contact list remains unchanged
Searches a user by their phone number. Returns a 404 error if the user can't be found
Shares the phone number of the current user with a mutual contact. Supposed to be called when the user clicks on chatActionBarSharePhoneNumber
documentation.user_id: Identifier of the user with whom to share the phone number. The user must be a mutual contact

documentation.description: Returns the profile photos of a user. The result of this query may be outdated: some photos might have been deleted already
documentation.offset: The number of photos to skip; must be non-negative
documentation.limit: The maximum number of photos to be returned; up to 100

documentation.description: Returns stickers from the installed sticker sets that correspond to a given emoji. If the emoji is non-empty, favorite and recently used stickers may also be returned
documentation.emoji: String representation of emoji. If empty, returns all known installed stickers
documentation.limit: The maximum number of stickers to be returned

documentation.description: Searches for stickers from public sticker sets that correspond to a given emoji
documentation.emoji: String representation of emoji; must be non-empty
documentation.limit: The maximum number of stickers to be returned

documentation.description: Returns a list of installed sticker sets
documentation.is_masks: Pass true to return mask sticker sets; pass false to return ordinary sticker sets

documentation.description: Returns a list of archived sticker sets
documentation.is_masks: Pass true to return mask stickers sets; pass false to return ordinary sticker sets
documentation.offset_sticker_set_id: Identifier of the sticker set from which to return the result
documentation.limit: The maximum number of sticker sets to return; up to 100

documentation.description: Returns a list of trending sticker sets. For optimal performance, the number of returned sticker sets is chosen by TDLib
documentation.offset: The offset from which to return the sticker sets; must be non-negative
documentation.limit: The maximum number of sticker sets to be returned; up to 100. For optimal performance, the number of returned sticker sets is chosen by TDLib and can be smaller than the specified limit, even if the end of the list has not been reached

documentation.description: Returns a list of sticker sets attached to a file. Currently, only photos and videos can have attached sticker sets
Returns information about a sticker set by its identifier
Searches for a sticker set by its name
documentation.name: Name of the sticker set

documentation.description: Searches for installed sticker sets by looking for specified query in their title and name
documentation.is_masks: Pass true to return mask sticker sets; pass false to return ordinary sticker sets
documentation.limit: The maximum number of sticker sets to return

documentation.description: Searches for ordinary sticker sets by looking for specified query in their title and name. Excludes installed sticker sets from the results
Installs/uninstalls or activates/archives a sticker set
documentation.is_archived: The new value of is_archived. A sticker set can't be installed and archived simultaneously

documentation.description: Informs the server that some trending sticker sets have been viewed by the user
documentation.sticker_set_ids: Identifiers of viewed trending sticker sets

documentation.description: Changes the order of installed sticker sets
documentation.is_masks: Pass true to change the order of mask sticker sets; pass false to change the order of ordinary sticker sets
documentation.sticker_set_ids: Identifiers of installed sticker sets in the new correct order

documentation.description: Returns a list of recently used stickers
documentation.is_attached: Pass true to return stickers and masks that were recently attached to photos or video files; pass false to return recently sent stickers

documentation.description: Manually adds a new sticker to the list of recently used stickers. The new sticker is added to the top of the list. If the sticker was already in the list, it is removed from the list first. Only stickers belonging to a sticker set can be added to this list
documentation.is_attached: Pass true to add the sticker to the list of stickers recently attached to photo or video files; pass false to add the sticker to the list of recently sent stickers

documentation.description: Removes a sticker from the list of recently used stickers
documentation.is_attached: Pass true to remove the sticker from the list of stickers recently attached to photo or video files; pass false to remove the sticker from the list of recently sent stickers

documentation.description: Clears the list of recently used stickers
documentation.is_attached: Pass true to clear the list of stickers recently attached to photo or video files; pass false to clear the list of recently sent stickers

documentation.description: Returns favorite stickers

Adds a new sticker to the list of favorite stickers. The new sticker is added to the top of the list. If the sticker was already in the list, it is removed from the list first. Only stickers belonging to a sticker set can be added to this list
Removes a sticker from the list of favorite stickers
documentation.sticker: Sticker file to delete from the list

documentation.description: Returns emoji corresponding to a sticker. The list is only for informational purposes, because a sticker is always sent with a fixed emoji from the corresponding Sticker object
Searches for emojis by keywords. Supported only if the file database is enabled
documentation.exact_match: Pass true if only emojis, which exactly match the text, needs to be returned
documentation.input_language_codes: List of possible IETF language tags of the user's input language; may be empty if unknown

documentation.description: Returns an animated emoji corresponding to a given emoji. Returns a 404 error if the emoji has no animated emoji
Returns all emojis, which has a corresponding animated emoji

always_parse_markdown.description: If true, text entities will be automatically parsed in all inputMessageText objects

archive_and_mute_new_chats_from_unknown_.description: If true, new chats from non-contacts will be automatically archived and muted. The option can be set only if the option “can_archive_and_mute_new_chats_from_unknown_users” is true. getOption needs to be called explicitly to fetch the latest value of the option, changed from another device

disable_animated_emoji.description: If true, animated emoji will be disabled and shown as plain emoji

disable_contact_registered_notifications.description: If true, notifications about the user's contacts who have joined Telegram will be disabled. User will still receive the corresponding message in the private chat. getOption needs to be called explicitly to fetch the latest value of the option, changed from another device

disable_persistent_network_statistics.description: If true, persistent network statistics will be disabled, which significantly reduces disk usage

disable_sent_scheduled_message_notificat.description: If true, notifications about outgoing scheduled messages that were sent will be disabled

disable_time_adjustment_protection.description: If true, protection from external time adjustment will be disabled, which significantly reduces disk usage

disable_top_chats.description: If true, support for top chats and statistics collection is disabled

ignore_background_updates.description: If true, allows to skip all updates received while the TDLib instance was not running. The option does nothing if the database or secret chats are used

ignore_default_disable_notification.description: If true, the disable_notification value specified in the request will be always used instead of the default value

ignore_inline_thumbnails.description: If true, prevents file thumbnails sent by the server along with messages from being saved on the disk

ignore_platform_restrictions.description: If true, chat and message restrictions specific to the currently used operating system will be ignored

ignore_sensitive_content_restrictions.description: If true, sensitive content will be shown on all user devices. getOption needs to be called explicitly to fetch the latest value of the option, changed from another device

is_location_visible.description: If true, other users will be allowed to see the current user's location. getOption needs to be called explicitly to fetch the latest value of the option, changed from another device

language_pack_database_path.description: Path to a database for storing language pack strings, so that this database can be shared between different accounts. By default, language pack strings are stored only in memory. Changes of value of this option will be applied only after TDLib restart, so it should be set before call to setTdlibParameters.

language_pack_id.description: Identifier of the currently used language pack from the current localization target

localization_target.description: Name for the current localization target (currently supported: “android”, “android_x”, “ios”, “macos” and “tdesktop”)

message_unload_delay.description: The maximum time messages are stored in memory before they are unloaded, 60-86400; in seconds. Defaults to 60 for users and 1800 for bots

notification_group_count_max.description: Maximum number of notification groups to be shown simultaneously, 0-25

notification_group_size_max.description: Maximum number of simultaneously shown notifications in a group, 1-25. Defaults to 10

online.description: Online status of the current user

prefer_ipv6.description: If true, IPv6 addresses will be preferred over IPv4 addresses

use_pfs.description: If true, Perfect Forward Secrecy will be enabled for interaction with the Telegram servers for cloud chats

use_quick_ack.description: If true, quick acknowledgement will be enabled for outgoing messages

use_storage_optimizer.description: If true, the background storage optimizer will be enabled

utc_time_offset.description: A UTC time offset used for splitting messages by days. The option is reset automatically on each TDLib instance launch, so it needs to be set manually only if the time offset is changed during execution.

animation_search_bot_username.description: Username of a bot which can be used in inline mode for animations search

authentication_token.description: An authentication token to be used on subsequent authorizations and received when logging out

authorization_date.description: Point in time (Unix timestamp) when authorization was received

basic_group_size_max.description: Maximum number of members in a basic group

call_connect_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time to wait for call connection creation to be passed to libtgvoip

call_packet_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time to wait for call packet delivery to be passed to libtgvoip

can_archive_and_mute_new_chats_from_unkn.description: If true, the option “archive_and_mute_new_chats_from_unknown_users” can be changed

can_ignore_sensitive_content_restriction.description: If true, the option “ignore_sensitive_content_restrictions” can be changed

channel_bot_user_id.description: Identifier of the bot which is shown as the sender of messages sent on behalf of channels when viewed from an outdated client

expect_blocking.description: If true, access to Telegram is likely blocked for the user

forwarded_message_count_max.description: Maximum number of forwarded messages per one request

group_anonymous_bot_user_id.description: Identifier of the bot which is shown as the sender of anonymous messages in groups when viewed from an outdated client

message_caption_length_max.description: Maximum length of a message caption

message_text_length_max.description: Maximum length of a message text

pinned_archived_chat_count_max.description: Maximum number of pinned cloud chats in the Archive chat list. The same amount of secret chats can be pinned locally

pinned_chat_count_max.description: Maximum number of pinned cloud chats in the Main chat list. The same amount of secret chats can be pinned locally

photo_search_bot_username.description: Username of a bot which can be used in inline mode for photos search

suggested_language_pack_id.description: Identifier of the language pack, suggested for the user by the server

suggested_video_note_audio_bitrate.description: Suggested bit rate for audio encoding in video notes, in kbit/s

suggested_video_note_length.description: Suggested width and height of the video in video notes

suggested_video_note_video_bitrate.description: Suggested bit rate for video encoding in video notes, in kbit/s

supergroup_size_max.description: Maximum number of members in a supergroup

t_me_url.description: Current value of t.me URL, i.e. https://t.me/

test_mode.description: If true, the test environment is being used instead of the production environment

version.description: TDLib version. This options is guaranteed to come before all other updates since TDLib 1.4.0
